metadata.Title: CVE-2010-2900 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 5.0.375.125 does not properly handle a large canvas, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-2900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit is a fork of khtml from kdelibs. kdelibs5 is farther from it, while qt4-x11 attempts to unify khtml and webkit. mdeslaur> webkitkde is a wrapper around qt4-x11's webkit. chromium specific (android only?)

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
